title: Hot Weather Poses New Risk as Thousands Remain Without Power After Deadly Houston Storm
message:
“Don’t overdo yourself during the cleanup process,” the weather service’s Houston office said in a post on the social platform X.
In addition to the heat, the Houston area could face poor air quality during the weekend.
HUNDREDS OF THOUSANDS REMAIN WITHOUT POWERThe widespread destruction of Thursday’s storms brought much of Houston to a standstill.
School districts in the Houston area canceled classes Friday for more than 400,000 students and government offices were closed.
“It felt terrifying.”STATE AND FEDERAL RECOVERY ASSISTANCE ON THE WAYIn light of the storm damage, Harris County Judge Lina Hidalgo and Whitmire both signed disaster declarations, paving the way for state and federal storm recovery assistance.

title: Deadly storms leave Houston area reeling with power outages and health risks
message:
Thunderstorms and hurricane-force winds tore through the city - decimating the facade of one brick building and leaving trees, debris and shattered glass on the streets.
A tornado also touched down near the northwest Houston suburb of Cypress.More than a half-million homes and businesses in Texas remained without electricity by midday Saturday, according to PowerOutage.us.
Another 21,000 customers were also without power in Louisiana, where strong winds and a suspected tornado hit.
"You know we don't have any power.
"I could definitely tell that this storm was a little different," she said.

title: Hot weather poses new risk as thousands remain without power after deadly Houston storm
message:
Hot weather poses new risk as thousands remain without power after deadly Houston stormKaren Warren / Houston Chronicle via Associated PressHOUSTON — As the Houston area works to clean up and restore power to hundreds of thousands after deadly storms left at least seven people dead, it will do so amid a smog warning and scorching temperatures that could pose health risks.
“Don’t overdo yourself during the cleanup process,” the weather service’s Houston office said in a post on the social platform X.
In addition to the heat, the Houston area could face poor air quality during the weekend.
HUNDREDS OF THOUSANDS REMAIN WITHOUT POWERThe widespread destruction of Thursday's storms brought much of Houston to a standstill.
School districts in the Houston area canceled classes Friday for more than 400,000 students and government offices were closed.

title: Hikurangi Subduction Zone : The burning question about NZ biggest quake - maker
message:
An explanation of the slow-slip earthquakes associated with New Zealand's Hikurangi Subduction Zone.
Now, scientists have edged closer to answering perhaps the most important question about our big-risk Hikurangi Subduction Zone: what controls the system’s suspected release valve.
The general location of the offshore part of the Hikurangi Subduction Zone.
Each of those geological profiles and everything in between can be found within the Hikurangi Subduction Zone - explaining why such a large range of earthquake types happen on it.
Specifically, they tend to happen within areas where the subduction zone is transitioning from being "stuck" beneath the southern North Island to an area where the subduction zone is "creeping" further north, around Gisborne and Hawke's Bay.

title: Alberta wildfire information update : May 18 , 3 p . m .
message:
A more accurate scan of the wildfire perimeter has resulted in a reduced area – 19,582 hectares – affected by wildfire.
Current wildfire information is available on the Alberta Wildfire Status Dashboard.
EducationAlberta Emergency AlertsFor up-to-the-minute Alberta Emergency Alert information visit: Alberta Emergency Alert.
Albertans are encouraged to download the Alberta Emergency Alert mobile app which immediately pushes all alerts out to subscribers.
Wildfire UpdatesMinister of Forestry and Parks Todd Loewen will provide a weekly briefing with officials from Alberta Wildfire and the Alberta Emergency Management Agency on Thursday mornings at 9:30 a.m.MultimediaRelated information

title: Children centre stage at Chelsea Flower Show as green issues high on agenda
message:
Youngsters are also being recruited to judge Chelsea Flower Show gardens for the first time, with 72 children from nine London primary schools participating as junior judges.
This year at the Chelsea Flower Show, all the large gardens have gone through a “green audit” as part of efforts to reduce the event’s environmental footprint.
Helena Pettit RHS director of show, said: “The Green garden audit, all gardens living on after the show and our new environmental innovation award, makes this one of our greenest RHS Chelsea Flower Show’s in recent history.
They include “Chelsea repurposed”, designed by Darryl Moore of Cityscapes, a garden made from reused materials from previous years’ RHS Chelsea show gardens, including steel columns from the Daily Telegraph exhibit in 2010.
And willow sculptures of the Queen’s beloved dogs Beth and Bluebell are to make an appearance at the Chelsea Flower Show this year when the Highgrove Gardens shop features for the first time.

title: Houston surveys destruction from deadly storms and races to restore power as Southeast and Gulf Coast face flood threat
message:
My condolences go out to the families that lost a loved one during yesterday’s severe weather event,” Gonzalez said.
The damaging storms will be followed by high temperatures in the 90s through the weekend and beyond while many are without air conditioning.
“Isolated to scattered severe thunderstorms appear possible across portions of the Southeast and Carolinas on Saturday, and parts of the Upper Midwest,” the center said.
The greatest chances for severe weather are across parts of Nebraska and Kansas, with a slight level 2 of 5 risk of severe thunderstorms issued by the Storm Prediction Center.
By the end of the weekend, thunderstorm chances will diminish for most of the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic, the weather service said.

title: Children centre stage at Chelsea Flower Show as green issues high on agenda
message:
Children are taking centre stage at this year’s Chelsea Flower Show, which is being billed as “one of the greenest” in years with a focus on sustainability and the climate crisis.
Youngsters are also being recruited to judge Chelsea Flower Show gardens for the first time, with 72 children from nine London primary schools participating as junior judges.
This year at the Chelsea Flower Show, all the large gardens have gone through a “green audit” as part of efforts to reduce the event’s environmental footprint.
They include “Chelsea repurposed”, designed by Darryl Moore of Cityscapes, a garden made from reused materials from previous years’ RHS Chelsea show gardens, including steel columns from the Daily Telegraph exhibit in 2010.
And willow sculptures of the Queen’s beloved dogs Beth and Bluebell are to make an appearance at the Chelsea Flower Show this year when the Highgrove Gardens shop features for the first time.

title: 4 . 7 Magnitude Earthquake Reported | NewsRadio 1360 KKTX
message:
A 4.7-magnitude earthquake struck Japan on Saturday (May 18), according to the United States Geological Survey.
The Tennessee earthquake struck days after a 3.8-magnitude earthquake struck Tennessee on Thursday (May 16), according to the United States Geological Survey.
The Tennessee earthquake struck hours after a 4.0-magnitude earthquake struck California on Wednesday (May 15), according to the United States Geological Survey.
The California earthquake struck hours after a 5.6-magnitude earthquake struck Puerto Rico on Tuesday (May 14), according to the United States Geological Survey.
The Puerto Rico earthquake was reported hours after a 5.1-magnitude earthquake struck Indonesia on Tuesday, according to the United States Geological Survey.

title: 4 . 7 Magnitude Earthquake Reported
message:
A 4.7-magnitude earthquake struck Japan on Saturday (May 18), according to the United States Geological Survey.
The Tennessee earthquake struck days after a 3.8-magnitude earthquake struck Tennessee on Thursday (May 16), according to the United States Geological Survey.

The Puerto Rico earthquake was reported hours after a 5.1-magnitude earthquake struck Indonesia on Tuesday, according to the United States Geological Survey.

title: Widespread power outages from deadly Houston storm raise new risk : hot weather
message:
"Don't overdo yourself during the cleanup process," the weather service's Houston office said in a post on the social platform X.
In addition to the heat, the Houston area could face poor air quality during the weekend.
Hundreds of thousands remain without powerThe widespread destruction of Thursday's storms brought much of Houston to a standstill.
School districts in the Houston area canceled classes Friday for more than 400,000 students and government offices were closed.
State and federal recovery assistance is on the wayIn light of the storm damage, Harris County Judge Lina Hidalgo and Whitmire both signed disaster declarations, paving the way for state and federal storm recovery assistance.

title: Severe winds cancel Idaho Falls circus - LocalNews8 . com
message:
IDAHO FALLS, Idaho (KIFI) - Wind gusts of 60 miles per hour forced the Cirque Ma’Ceo equestrian circus to cancel Friday’s Idaho Falls performance.
“I’m being extremely calm right now, but my heart is right here listening to that wind,” he added.
Then again, it’s also its first time in Idaho Falls.
“The only time I’ve ever experienced wind like this is when this tent had gone through a hurricane,” Zoppe said.
“Wind is the worst type of weather a big top can endure.”The winds were also strong enough to tip over porta-potties, so the circus battened down the hatches.
